North Mac CUSD #34 is Closed for remainder of the 2019-20 School Year
April 17, 2020
Dear North Mac Parents and Students,

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

span.strong: North Mac CUSD #34 is Closed for remainder of the 2019-20 School Year

span.span: Dear North Mac Parents and Students,

I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. Today, as I am sure you are now aware, Illinois Governor JB Pritzker announced that Remote Learning in Illinois will be extended through the end of the 2019-20 school year. Although in-person learning has been suspended for the remainder of this school year, I assure you that here at North Mac our entire staff remains committed to engaging with all students through Remote Learning, as well as continuing with our food distribution program.

Like you, we are saddened by the reality that our school community will not be able to reconvene in person due to this public health crisis. We understand that after months of hard work and commitment to academic and extracurricular endeavors, it is difficult for this school year to come to such an abrupt and unceremonious end. When we think of all of our students, from those at the elementary who didn’t get to properly say goodbye to their teachers, all the way up to our seniors who lost the last months of their high school years, we are truly saddened and wish we could find a way to make things right. However, the final chapter of this school year hasn’t been written yet. These past few weeks have proven that our school community is as resilient, as capable and as compassionate as I have always believed it to be. I am confident that our collective strength will shine through during the remainder of the school year, and we will emerge even stronger.

Having said that, today’s announcement will result in significant and multiple scheduling changes in our district. As this announcement about the end of the school year was just made by Governor Pritzker this afternoon, it will take us a few days to sort out the many schedule details that are on the books, including spring concerts, promotion, graduation, etc. Please be patient as we work as a district to get information to you in the next several weeks. Until then, please continue to engage in the Remote Learning activities that your teacher(s) have provided.

For our seniors and their parents, please know that one of our top priorities is to plan and hold a graduation ceremony that will properly honor the academic achievements that our seniors have accomplished over the past thirteen years of their lives. While we don’t know what that will look like yet, or when it might take place, you can be assured that we will continue to strive to make a graduation ceremony a reality, and make it one that this year’s seniors will never forget.

I know this is not the school year that any of us imagined or wanted, but I want to thank you for your patience, understanding and support during this unprecedented situation. This period of Remote Learning offers us new ways to learn and grow, and out of this Pandemic, we will emerge stronger.

It’s important we continue to work together and support our students. Please communicate often with your child’s teacher(s) and your child’s school administrators if you have questions or concerns. I can't thank you enough for all that you are doing as we all work together through this. Stay safe and stay strong Panther Nation!
